message.content:
cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CY, cs.OH

Reasoning: 
1. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper focuses on designing a mobile health system for elderly patients, which involves the use of wearable sensors and a smartphone as a central node. This falls under the domain of human-computer interaction, as the system is designed to be user-friendly and accessible to elderly patients.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The system uses GPRS/UMTS to transmit sensor data to an intelligent server for analysis. This involves networking and internet architecture, as the system relies on wireless communication protocols to transmit data.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The system involves the integration of multiple components, including wearable sensors, a smartphone, and an intelligent server. This requires a systems and control approach to ensure that all components work together seamlessly.
4. cs.CY (Computers and Society) - The paper discusses the use of technology to monitor elderly patients, which has implications for society as a whole. This falls under the domain of computers and society, as it involves the ethical and social implications of using technology in healthcare.
5. cs.OH (Other Computer Science) - The paper covers a broad range of topics, including wearable sensors, mobile health systems, and wireless communication protocols. This could potentially fall under the category of other computer science, as it does not fit neatly into any specific sub
